originalText.text: Excellent place in the middle of the city. I always prefer self parking garage when visiting the city. Was leaving the car at a self o place at battery park and took the subway before. This time found tried the mpg Manhattan parking after coming across the website. It’s absolutely amazing. Register, book online get the QR code and scan it directly from your phone at the gate. Same thing when you exit. EZ as 1-2-3. Spots are great large enough to be safe. Only thing you need to keep an eye on is the wall on some spots. This place is my #1 when visiting the city from now on. Price? It’s surprisingly very affordable. 8:15 - 3:30 parking was $24. Safe, with on-site people which are very friendly. Highly recommended!

originalText.text: We were staying at Pods across on 42nd st. This place was perfect we paid 50.00 a night for 2 days. We got a code on line from MPG scanned the QR code from my phone the gate opened it was that easy the same with exiting Thanks MPG

originalText.text:
I had an online reservation on hands and at drop off the employee would not even let me drive into the garage. He started yelling and very aggressively said there was no more spaces. A second employee arrived and decided to look at the reservation details and took the car but also very rude.

At pick up, the only employee on site shut the doors right at my face at 2pm and said there was no employees and his shift had ended. Rudely told me to look for the main office down the street. Just could get my car almost 2 hours later. What a nightmare!

originalText.text: Close to Lincoln tunnel, went today from around 1pm to about 9pm and cost was around $52. Don't forget to take your ticket with you because when you get back you can pay before you leave. This way you have a validated ticket to let you out.

text.text: Close to Lincoln tunnel, went today from around 1pm to about 9pm and cost was around $52. Don't forget to take your ticket with you because when you get back you can pay before you leave. This way you have a validated ticket to let you out.

originalText.text: Having to drive to NYC from Canada, I was a bit apprehensive to park anywhere for a week in NYC. The reviews were bleak and scary for most of the places, even after spending dearly. This was one place that had relatively decent reviews and I rolled the dice on this one. I booked online, and I am pleased to report that the whole process had been smooth. The entry and exit werehassle- free, as I didn't need to get out of my car or speak to somebody (though I observed there was someone that manned this place for assistance all the time). If I ever brought my car into the city again, this is where I know i'm gonna park my car.
